resources.string: Turn your phone into a tracing lightbox. Point your camera at your drawing surface, pick a reference image, and trace with precision.
Select the option that matches your equipment.
Full DIY — Print your own markers

Print four ArUco markers (IDs #0\u2013#3) at about 2\u00a0cm each. Tape them at the four corners of your drawing area, so your hands never cover them. Prop your phone about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above the surface so the camera sees all four markers.

Print the ArUco marker sheet from the setup guide. Cut out markers #0\u2013#3, tape them at the four corners of your drawing area. Position your phone about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above so all markers stay visible while you draw.

Print the ArUco marker sheet. Tape markers #0\u2013#3 at the four corners. Mount your phone on the stand about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above the surface \u2014 high enough to see all four markers, low enough to trace comfortably.
Camera permission is required for the walkthrough
Point your camera at your markers
Try adjusting the angle or lighting
TraceGlass uses four ArUco markers (small black-and-white grid patterns) placed at the corners of your drawing area for tracking.
Download the marker sheet from the link below, or search for \"ArUco 4x4 markers 0–3\" online. Print them at about 2\u00a0cm each.
Cut out markers #0, #1, #2, and #3. Tape them at the four corners of your drawing area, just outside the zone you want to trace.
Place your phone about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above the drawing surface, camera pointing down. It should be high enough to see all four markers, but low enough to trace comfortably.
Make sure all four markers stay visible to the camera while you draw. Avoid covering them with your hand or paper.
No tripod? No problem. Use everyday objects to hold your phone about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above your drawing surface, camera pointing down.

Place a tall glass of water next to your paper. Lean your phone against it, camera pointing down. The glass provides stable support and the water adds weight. Aim for about 25\u201330\u00a0cm above the surface.
Stack 3\u20134 books at the edge of your desk to reach about 25\u201330\u00a0cm high. Prop your phone between the top two books, angled downward toward your drawing area.

Place a box or container (about 25\u201330\u00a0cm tall) upside down near your paper. Balance your phone on the edge with the camera hanging over, pointing down. Use a rubber band to secure if needed.
